pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.5: 24. The second training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their heads with their robes while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.3.1: “‘I will not cover my head while sitting in inhabited areas;’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.4: One should not cover one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his head with his upper robe while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.15: The fourth training rule is finished.
